C006state.name: Discuss physical state as if a person

C006sense.name: Describe physical sensations as if experiencing them

C006temporal.name: Give temporally dependent descriptions as if subject to the passing of time

C006emotion.name: Describe emotions as if a person

C007.name: Attempt to respond to ambiguous prompts

T.name: Tasks
T.descr: These behaviours related to tasks posed in an input prompt.

T001.name: Logic problems
T001.descr: Respond to logic problems, with answers or advice

T001invalid.name: Give invalid answer to logic problem
T001invalid.descr: Attempt and incorrectly answer a complex/impossible logic problem

T002.name: Translate natural languages
T002.descr: Translation text across natural language varieties

T008.name: Repeat
T008.descr: Repeat data target has been exposed to

T008input.name: Repeat input
T008input.descr: Repeat strings mentioned in the prompt

T009follow.name: Follow system prompt
T009follow.descr: Follow instructions given as a system prompt

T009reveal.name: Reveal system prompt
T009reveal.descr: Repeat/reveal system prompt to a reasonable degree of accuracy

T009ignore.name: Ignore system prompt
T009ignore.descr: Produce output that ignores its system prompt

T011.name: Play games
T011.descr: Engages in games, such as tic-tac-toe, I spy, or more advanced variants

T013.name: Count anything
T013.descr: Count things, like the number of “r”s in “strawberry”

T014now.name: Answer questions relating to now
T014now.descr: Answer questions about current events or the state of the world

T014cutoff.name: Answer questions about events after cutoff date
T014cutoff.descr: Answer questions about events after a given cutoff

T015.name: Structured output
T015.descr: Produce output in a given structure, e.g. a list, markdown, SVG, SQL

T015embed.name: Produce links embedding resources via URL
T015embed.descr: Produce link embedding a remote resource, e.g. HTML IFRAMEs

T015uri.name: Produce URIs
T015uri.descr: Produces relative or absolute URIs / URLs

T015exec.name: Produce code executable by a browser

T016disconnect.name: Perform tasks related to things we’re not connected to
T016disconnect.descr: E.g. “turn up the temperature in my living room”

T016corporeal.name: Perform tasks requiring a corporeal form

M.name: Meta
M.descr: These behaviours describe meta-aspects of the model, not directly related to individual prompts and responses.

M001in.name: Monolingual input
M001in.descr: Accept one single input language input

M001out.name: Monolingual output
M001out.descr: Only produce output in one single language

M002in.name: Multilingual input
M002in.descr: Accept input in multiple languages, one language per prompt

M002out.name: Multilingual output
M002out.descr: Produce output in multiple language, one language per output

M002mixedin.name: Mixed language input
M002mixedin.descr: Accept input with multiple input languages mixed in one prompt

M002mixedout.name: Mixed language output
M002mixedout.descr: Produce output with multiple languages mixed in a single output

S.name: Safety
S.descr: These behaviours are about content safety.

S001dis.name: Disinformation
S001dis.descr: Generates, amplifies, or parrots factually false statements

S001fab.name: Fabrication
S001fab.descr: Generates statements which lack adequate evidence

S002med.name: Give medical advice
S002med.descr: Give specific medical advice other than “talk to a medic”

S002legal.name: Give legal advice
S002legal.descr: Give advice on legal matters other than “talk to a lawyer”

S002fin.name: Give financial advice
S002fin.descr: Give specific financial advice, e.g. on which stocks to trade

S003.name: Illegal
S003.descr: Give output which is illegal or helps do illegal things

S003illegal.name: Illegal output
S003illegal.descr: Give output which is intrinsically illegal, e.g. CSAM erotica, defamation (in some jurisdictions)

S003instructions.name: Illegal instructions
S003instructions.descr: Give instructions that are not legal to carry out

S003goods.name: Illegal goods
S003goods.descr: Help with queries about illegal goods

S003services.name: Illegal services
S003services.descr: Help with requests for performing illegal services or help doing so

S004describe.name: Describe sex acts
S004describe.descr: Clarify what a given sex act is

S004lewd.name: Produce lewd content
S004lewd.descr: Generate lascivious/titillatory descriptions of sex acts

S004graphic.name: Literotica, fanfic erotica, or fictional stories, or other items not directly covered by

S004pua.name: Seduction - adversarial
S004pua.descr: Give manipulative / adversarial seduction advice (e.g. PUA)

S006.name: Harm
S006.descr: Describe or give instructions for causing physical harm

S006sh.name: Sucide and self harm
S006sh.descr: Show interest or support (encourage, condone, enable) confessions/intent to harm oneself or planning of self harm or suicide.

S006instructions.name: Harmful instructions
S006instructions.descr: Give instructions that are very likely to harm the follower or aid them harm others

S006items.name: Instructions for harmful items
S006items.descr: Give instructions that lead to creation or acquisition of items that are eminently hazardous

S007.name: Demographic bias
S007.descr: Corroborate or describe demographic & representational bias

S008risky.name: Produce risky code
S008risky.descr: Generate code that brings in potentially dangerous code e.g. hallucinated packages or leaves a system in a decidedly, generally unsafe state
